page.title: 16BUILDINGS: DANE END & AREA
page.content: {Dane End House}is the largest private house in the area and was built in the 19th Century. It was at one time the home of{LORD GLADSTONE}but it has also been a residential school for foreign students but it is now a private dwelling. There are a number of timber faced houses in the area and one of these in Dane End is called{'THE OLD MISSION {HOUSE'}and it used to be the chapel. {HUNT'S COTTAGE}was built in 1350 and is probably the oldest house in the area. It was originally a 'hall' house and inhabited by an important person. It is thought that the family probably moved to{Lordship Farm}(just outside the D-block) in 1650. At one time it was converted into three houses but 30 years ago it was converted into two. The present owner is carrying out restoration work.
